loan_because: we care about families (past, present and future).
description:
Genealogists worldwide (plus relatives and friends) have found a simple way to help less fortunate families. In 2011 'Genealogists for Families' received an award for Best New Community Project.

Through Kiva, a non-profit organisation working with microfinance institutions, you choose a borrower to support with a loan of just $25. Similar loans by other lenders are combined until the required total is reached. This enables people without access to traditional banks (including many women) to expand their businesses, support and educate their children, save for the future and raise themselves out of poverty. As your money is repaid (often in monthly instalments), you can withdraw it or lend it to someone else. Money that is loaned over and over again does more good than a one-time donation!

Anyone *who makes a loan* through Kiva can be a member of this team. You can invite your family and friends to join even if they are not involved in genealogy.

** Please read http://genfamilies.blogspot.com/search/label/FAQ (which has important information and answers to frequently asked questions).

name: 30% Max
loan_because: We want to change the World without predatory practices. We believe microloan interests should be as low as possible: 30% (PY/APR) Maximum. We are the only team we are aware that has this cap.
description:
The team members should be united by our pledge “Not lending through Kiva Partners that charge more than 30% PY/APR for servicing a loan.” 
If Kiva Partner, Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) can charge 17% PY/APR for their loans and still make a profit, there is no reason why a For Profit Non Regulated institutions like Kiva Partner Credituyo should charge 85.9% PY/APR in Mexico.  Do you know how high the PY/APR is  for the loans you patricipate? 

These are some Kiva Partners PY "Portafolio Yield" (aka INTEREST)examples:

name: CORENA - Citizens Own Renewable Energy Network Australia
loan_because: We want to empower people and communities to take action on climate change, by helping them become part of the clean energy revolution!
description:
This Lending Team was set up to enable members of CORENA to fund solar projects outside of Australia, while at the same time spreading the word about CORENA to people on Kiva. CORENA's projects are all based in Australia and are funded through our website, corenafund.org.au. The loans made on Kiva in the name of this Lending Team are in no way funded by donations made to CORENA. 

CORENA (Citizens Own Renewable Energy Network Australia Inc) is a people-powered funding mechanism, not unlike Kiva, designed to speed up the transition to 100% renewable energy. 

**Quick Win project fund (rolling)
CORENA uses the donated funds to give an interest-free loan to a non-profit community organisation to pay for solar panels (and other efficiency measures), and they pay back the loan out of subsequent savings on their power bills (it doesn't cost them a cent!) The loan repayments then go towards funding the next Quick Win project(s). CORENA was formed in 2013, and has already completed seventeen installations, which are now helping fund the 18th project.

**Big Win project fund 
We plan to build Australia's first community-owned, large scale (50MW) Solar Thermal plant with molten salt storage at Port Augusta, in South Australia. The plant will provide cheap, clean energy that never runs out, and will be owned collectively by ‘the people’ and operated for the benefit of all. If around 720,000 people each contribute $8 per week for ONE year, we can fund this project entirely by donations. There’ll be no loan repayments or dividends to shareholders, so all profits will be used to build yet more people’s solar plants.

name: Friends of Sadie and Cole
loan_because: We believe that with just a little help, hard working people can make a better life for themselves and their families.
description:
Dear friends and family,

As my birthday and the holidays approach, I have been asked the question for the 37th year in a row “So….. what do you want?”

As most of you know, the last couple of years have been a big transition for me, turning my career towards the issue of poverty in developing countries. Last year while living in South Africa, Melissa, Sadie, Cole and I saw firsthand how people in poverty live. I’ve learned how poor people don’t really want “hand outs”, but could certainly use a “hand up”.

This holiday season, the only gift I really want is for my friends and family to experience what that means to me. All it will take is 25 minutes and a loan of $25. KIVA.org is a website that allows you to make a $25 loan to a micro-entrepreneur in a developing country, so that they can build a business to develop income and provide for their family. On the website, you can choose the specific entrepreneur and the business that you want to lend to: for example a restaurateur in Cambodia, a goat herder in Uganda, or a farmer in Peru. Since 2005, KIVA has provided over 340,000 loans worth $260M dollars with an amazing 98.3% repayment rate. That means you not only help someone get their business off the ground, but history says there is a 98.3% chance you get your $25 back! KIVA has won many awards, and has been profiled by Time Magazine, Fortune, New York Times, not to mention being named as one of Oprah’s favorite things.

I’ve created an online lending team with KIVA called “Friends of Sadie and Cole” and am hoping you can help me get to a total of 25 loans on there by Dec 25. Click here: http://www.kiva.org/team/friends_of_sadie_and_cole to learn more.

Here’s a short video on how it works: http://vimeo.com/16991128

25 minutes and $25 could be a game changer to help someone in the developing world get on their feet in 2012. Would love to hear your opinions and what you thought about the experience. 

Thanks and looking forward to celebrating this holiday season with you, whether in person or from afar!

Albert

name: Smile Train
loan_because:
There are millions of children with unrepaired cleft lips and palates who have little to no prospect of ever being helped. Their parents are so poor they could never afford surgery. Being born with a cleft in a developing country is truly a curse, and no one knows how many newborns with clefts are killed or abandoned right after birth.  

Through Smile Train's free cleft surgery program, a 45 minute surgery gives these children a future and a second chance at life that they never thought they'd get. Let's change the world, one smile at a time!

Through our Kiva lending we want to raise awareness and support of the wonderful work Smile Train does in providing free cleft repair surgeries around the world. If our team logo is displayed on loans' top lending teams we hope other Kiva lenders will learn about Smile Train's work too.  Won't you join us?
.
description:
We are a diverse group of Kiva lenders from different backgrounds and different areas of the world who share a common desire to support the effort to bring a repair surgery to every child who needs one.  Our team also includes staff members of Smile Train and Kiva and other microfinance ventures.  We would be happy for you to join our team too!

The little girl in our team logo is Pinki Sonkar.  She was born with a severe cleft into a family that was surviving on less than a dollar a day in a poor rural village in India. She could not go to school because the other children threw rocks at her.  Smile Pinki tells the story of how her life was changed forever by a free repair surgery at a Smile Train partner hospital.  Contact a team captain for more information if you would like a free DVD of this Academy Award winning documentary.

Where is Pinki Now - http://bit.ly/WhereisPinkiNow - This 5 minute video has interviews with Pinki's parents and teachers and video of Pinki in school.  You can see that cleft surgery brings a total transformation to the lives of these kids.

Wang Li Got Married - http://bit.ly/WangLi - this video tells the moving story of Smile Train's very first patient and how her life was totally changed.

Smile Train in Mexico - http://bit.ly/SmileMexico - this video is for Adrián and the Arenal Group. As a team we loaned to help his parents, and we hope that through Smile Train Adrián will get the care that he needs.

Kiva Team Smile Train fund raiser page - http://bit.ly/DonateTeamSmileTrain - If you would like to make donation to support Smile Train's work you can do so here.  Even if you don't make a donation, please sign our guest book!      Thank you for helping the kids!      

Other tax advantaged donation links:
Canada - http://www.canadahelps.org/CharityProfilePage.aspx?CharityID=s98822
Great Britain - http://www.smiletrain.org.uk/
India - http://www.smiletrainindia.org/
Italy - http://www.smiletrain.it/

Check out the distribution of our team's impact around the world:  http://kivafolio.appspot.com/report?user=Smile_Train

Check our team statistics:  http://smiletrain.vijayr.net/stats.php

name: Kiva Flash Mob
loan_because:
we want to bring lenders from different teams together and show some Kiva love to loans have so far been overlooked. We want to help get them funded by organizing a Flash Mob to these loans.  

The effect of many lenders loaning to the same loan AT AROUND THE SAME TIME, is that the loan will show up on page 1 of the popularity sort, which is the default page that most lenders look at when they come to Kiva. So besides the loans from the Flash Mob team, Flash Mob loans often attract many additional loans from other lenders who just happened to log into Kiva at this time. Sometimes a loan gets completely funded within the hour!

Feel free to keep attributing your loans to your favorite team, it is fun to see many different team logos on the same loan.
description:
Primary Flash Mob time is 9am US West Coast / noon EST / 6pm MET / 4am AET

If you can't join the primary Flash Mob, a second Flash Mob time is 11pm US West Coast / 2am EST / 8am MET / 6pm AET.

The loan will be posted two to three  hours in advance to give you time to research it. For maximum Flash Mob impact, please try to loan exactly at Flash Mob time.

For email alerts with just the daily loan link, please join http://www.kiva.org/team/KFM_messages and set your email preferences for that team to immediate delivery. For a comprehensive description of the Flash Mob loan, to talk to other Flash Mobbers and to suggest loans, please join this team. 

Loans selected for the Flash Mob are typically within 2 weeks of expiration (preferably red-boxed) and completely unfunded or lacking a substantial amount. For suggestions please message the captains.

description: We're connected to the Louisville-area through birth, destiny, travel, family, or friendships. We live here, work here, travel here, or otherwise care about the city and Southern Indiana and want to support local entrepreneurs.

name: Iranian American Philanthropy Team
loan_because: It's an engrained part of our culture to help our fellow (wo)man and we are united to do our part in the global community.
description: A lending hand from Iranian Americans.

name: University of Tokyo

name: Marxists, Leninists, Socialists, Communists, General Critics of Capitalism
Ian Martin Group
loan_because:
We see a world with each and every person pursuing meaningful work.

We are committed to "Redeeming the Resume Black Hole" by asking all 100,000+ people who annually apply to jobs through the Ian Martin Group to use our funds to make a loan on Kiva! 

For more:
http://ianmartin.com/blog/2014/01/redeeming-the-resume-black-hole/

Check out our progress here: http://www.kiva.org/team/ianmartin/goals
description:
Founded in 1957, the Ian Martin Group is North America's most progressive recruitment and project-staffing firm.  As a Certified B Corporation, we meet comprehensive standards that measure our impact on employees, suppliers, community, and the environment. Our guiding statement is: “building authentic connections around meaningful work.”
 
http://ianmartin.com
http://bcorporation.net/ianmartingroup

name: David Coates Memorial
loan_because: We want to honor the memory of a loving father and wonderful husband.
description: Family and friends of David Coates

name: Anarchocapitalists
loan_because: Because freedom and money makes it possible. The ones that doesn't own themselves aren't free. Therefore we loan to give the opportunity to others to make them able to own themselves.\n\nWe lend because we believe in capitalism and individuals who voluntarily help others, and not state mandated force.
description: Freedom lovers.

name: Eric and Penny's wedding
loan_because: It's a great opportunity to make a difference in the world.

name: Pair of Hands

name: BOINC AT AUSTRALIA
loan_because: Everyone deserves a chance to improve their life through hard work, perseverance and a little help from a friend.
description: We are a group of individuals who use BOINC (http://boinc.berkeley.edu/) and our computers to do scientific research at Universities around the world. Join us at our website. Everyone is welcome.

name: Lauren Avezzie
loan_because: Lauren cared about justice and equality for the disadvantaged. She believed in hard work and commitment. Women's rights and their advancement in society was a priority as well. This is a great way to help keep her fight going.
description: This team is for anyone who loved Lauren or cares about what she believed in. Making these loans is a great chance to do good work in her name.

name: MiraCosta College
loan_because: We are blessed and want to help others throughout the world realize their dreams. We believe in micro-financing and the impact it is having in alleviating poverty, both locally and around the globe.
description: We are faculty, staff, students, alumni and friends of MiraCosta College, a California community college in northern San Diego County. We are proud Spartans.

name: Humanity Snowboards
loan_because: We are entrepreneurs and understand how hard it can be to start or grow a business.  We did it without bank loans and want to contribute where we can.
description: We are a group of humanitarians that sincerely believe in our own power to effect positive change in peoples' lives.

name: The Family Team
loan_because: ... we can, and we should
description: Private, and awesome.\nPlease don't apply to join unless I know you. This is a private team.

name: ImpactWomen
loan_because: Creating impact for women owned business
description: Creating impact for women owned business. We believe these loans will create strong economic change.

name: Bob Nambati Not Forgotten
loan_because: In memory of your lust for life, your ability to reach out to those in the US, South Africa, Australia, Panama, Peru and many in Europe.  May your mission to develop literacy and computer skills live on.
description: Family and Friends  of Andrew Robert Stokes, who wish to further his mission to improve English proficiency and computer literacy around the world.

name: Electric Animal Enthusiasts
loan_because: we like to support the owners of animals with electric light-up eyes.
description: We enjoy the eclectic photography offered by Kiva's various MFIs.  We particularly enjoy photos of animals that look like they could be the leads in sci-fi or horror movies.

name: Coffee Lovers
description: We would love the opportunity to support coffee growers, workers, millers, roasters, or vendors focused on producing or preparing quality coffee.

name: Riverside Food Coop
loan_because: We are a group of consumers working to open a cooperative grocery store.   We believe in local economies and assisting small businesses and potential suppliers, vendors, and farmers who will provide product for the coop store.
description: We are a group of consumers working to open a cooperative grocery store.    Our group is diverse in background, experience, and age.

name: Lenny gets Maryed
description: We are getting Married and want to use the occasion to help others.

name: LewisLenders

description: 3 people who started w/$75 in 2016.

name: Mos Eisley Cantina
loan_because: We Care

name: Nayla's Friends

description: Friends of Nayla who want to contribute perpetuate her ideals

name: Yazamo
loan_because: Dornubari Vizor grew up in Africa spending three years in UN refugee camps. Since then, Dornubari has been passionate about finding solutions to combat the poverty he grew up with. Dornubari and Jeremy met while students at Arizona State University. They both shared their passion helping others and cofounded Yazamo in 2012, a company that would match each contract with a loan through Kiva for a deserving entrepreneur in need.
description: At Yazamo, we are passionate about entrepreneurship and believe that it is the driving force for economic growth and the advancement of human welfare.

name: Aussie & Kiwi Savers
loan_because: We love the idea of giving people a hand up not a hand out.
description: Aussies & Kiwis who are members of a savings website

name: Kakbank Tepasen Stockholm
loan_because: We want to contribute.
description: Friends

name: How We Do DGS
loan_because: As a reminder that we're very lucky to have been born here.

name: Baldwin Wallace University
loan_because: We believe that the power of opportunity, the spirit of entrepreneurship, and universal financial inclusion can combat global poverty.
description: We hope to bring together BW students, faculty, staff, alumni, and families to create a lending community. This team is organized by the BW Microfinance Club, founded in 2015 by students to fundraise for and manage a microlending fund.

name: Grace Lutheran Hermantown
loan_because: God's Work Our Hands.  We believe in helping people in any way we can.
description: A motley collection of Christians with heart.

name: Zawadi by Youth
description: Our team is composed of high school students with a common goal - to help. Our group started out small, but it grows larger and larger. We now have 30 students, and we have attained 501(c)3 status. To raise money, we have benefits which bring together our community in the spirit of giving. Please visit ZawadibyYouth.org or contact John Pizzi at jpizzi@riverdale.edu for more information.

name: Veterinarians For Good
loan_because: We can, and because without animals and agriculture we could not survive.
description: Veterinarians, vet techs, and animal lovers, wanting to give a helping hand-up to people in need. Our focus is agriculture, animal husbandry, welfare, and veterinary medicine.

name: Wir unterstützen Afrika
loan_because: wir glauben, dass die gegenwärtigen Flüchtlingsprobleme nicht in Europa gelöst werden können, sondern nur in den Ländern der dritten Welt, wo Armut und zum Teil Hoffnungslosigkeit herrschen. Wir wollen helfen, durch Microkredite die Situation vor Ort zu verbessern und vor allem der jungen Generation in Afrika eine Chance bieten, eine bessere Welt zu erleben als die ihrer Eltern.
description: This is a team for Germans who want to band together to help support Africans in their search for a better life.

name: We Choose Compassion
loan_because: We choose compassion and care to take an active part in how and where we help.
description: A growing collection of friends, family, and random acquaintances with similar goals.

name: Business Performance
loan_because: every day we help people become more profitable in their business. However, all too many people do not have the opportunity to improve their lives easily. We greatly admire the entrepreneurial spirit; those courageous people who want to give it a go and create a better world for themselves and their family. We want to help you make the most of that desire for a better life.
description: Our company is based in Melbourne, Australia and serves an international client and customer base. We proudly supply business and management coaching services. In addition, we create and distribute a variety of software tools and guides designed to help business owners, managers and practitioners be more effective. We are passionate about developing people and helping businesses grow.

name: Amma Devotees
loan_because: We are living Amma's message to Love & Serve!
description: We are a group of devotees of Ammachi, known as the Hugging Saint.  She is from India and to date has given darshan (Her blessing) to almost thirty million people!  Her blessing is a hug!  Think of it - Amma has hugged almost thirty million people!  Amma tells us to help our fellow man, to love and serve others in need whenever and wherever we can.

name: Mary Baldwin College
loan_because: We are part of the Mary Baldwin Global Initiative and our Commitment to Action is to work through Kiva to provide micro loans to women all over the world.  As a women's college we beleive it is our duty to help empower women world wide and our work through Kiva is one way we are working toward this goal.
description: Our team is a group of Mary Baldwin students from all different backgrounds who have come together with one mission: to change the world. We are doing this through a variety commitments to work on such diverse issues from human trafficking to education to our work with Kiva and micro lending.

name: Choose Humanity
loan_because: can and will make a difference
description: People who choose to act

name: Becky's Hugs
loan_because: Becky was unfailingly generous during her short life (2001-2010).  She loved freely and without limit, and never met anyone she considered to be a stranger.  She was always ready with a hug for anyone who needed one, even when they didn't know it yet.  Loaning Becky's memory keeps her love alive, spreading her hugs around the world!
description:
We are a group of people who have been inspired by the love of a young lady named Becky, who was tragically killed 30 August 2010 at the age of 9½.  She loved unconditionally, and was always ready with a hug, even for complete strangers.  The living memorial of sharing hugs began immediately after her death, when her mother told her classmates to hug each other every day in her memory.  This team keeps Becky's love alive by sharing her hugs in the form of loans around the world.

To learn more about Becky and the impact of her short life, visit BeckysHugs.com, which will point you to the Becky's Hugs page on Facebook.  Look at the photos and videos to get a better idea about who Becky was, and check out the timeline to see the ways in which people have celebrated her memory and love.

Hugs to you!

name: The Richmond Group
loan_because: We work in the finance industry and think that Kiva is a wonderful innovation. Giving a helping hand to entrepreneurs will empower developing nations across the world to create a culture which will improve quality of life substantially.
description: The Richmond Group are companies providing consumer finance products in the UK.

name: Older Borrowers
loan_because: we want to support the bravery and exuberance of Kiva's older entrepreneurs!
description: We want to celebrate and support those of mature years who, whether through choice or necessity, keep working and struggling to improve their own lives and the lives of others. \n\nWe generally define older as 50+, given that in many Kiva countries average life expectancy is between 50 & 70 years.

name: Vita Coco
loan_because: Our founders Mike & Ira never forgot how far a little help can go when you’re just starting out. Today, we’re paying it forward by supporting and empowering entrepreneurs worldwide.\n
description: Our mission is simple: we want to make a real and meaningful impact not just on Vita Coco consumers, but on the lives of the people we work with and the communities they live in.

name: Team PInoy Expats
loan_because: There is a need.
description: We are expats from around the world that love the Philippines and its people.

name: By New York for New York
loan_because: We are lovers of small business and want to support our local hustlers.
description: Many of us work in the small business support industry. Some of us are official Kiva Advisors. Others of us are just fans of local lending!

name: Catherine's cut for Kiva: Ramsiola wedding!
loan_because: we want an L&R with a heart shaved into Catherine's hair to honor Liri and Ramsey's wedding!
description: Make your mark... in the life of a Kiva borrower and on Catherine's hair! Donations to this group = a vote for her to shave a heart with "L&R" in her hair.

name: The Herd Mentality
loan_because: Quite simply, The Herd Mentality Podcast is about giving people a voice. Primary focus is towards women in developing countries to further their education.
description: Bemused, frustrated and annoyed.

name: SunDown Group
loan_because: We are focused on helping companies be able to take the next step
description: Members of the SunDown Community that want to help out companies take the next step

name: Giverocity
loan_because: Saverocity gives!
description: We travel the world and make it look easy. Also, we give and make it look easy.

name: DRAAS - Danish Rural and Agricultural Advisory Service
#koalakrew
loan_because: We believe in the power of kindness.
description: Periscope and snapchat friends that have come together to help make a difference.

name: Tamils For Change
loan_because: We must
description: If we choose to ignore the world, can we really be surprised when the world chooses to ignore us?

name: Reaktor
loan_because: Maksamme velkaa

name: Elephants and Donkeys
loan_because: We believe that no matter what your political persuasion or which party or politician you support, you can find common ground with others who want to extend a helping hand to people in need.
description: We are open to anyone who seeks to build unity beyond politics and help others. We ask that all participants please use whatever social media platforms to spread the word and grow the team - and its lending power!

name: Newfoundland and Labrador
loan_because: Our history is about struggle and helping our fellow citizens
description: We are from a province of Canada with a population of less than one million people. We are the oldest British colony and the newest Canadian province.  Sixty years a province of Canada. \nWe are known for our generosity and willingness to help others in need. Canadian statistics have shown us to be among the most charitable people in Canada. \nI believe that our historic struggle to survive for over 500 years has instilled in us a common bond with people in need of a helping hand of kindness.

name: Draupnir
loan_because: Wealth is something to be shared
description: A group of friends that have meet every other week for 20+ years.

name: PuddleJump with Dan
loan_because: in the words of George Bernard Shaw, "People who say it cannot be done should get out of the way of the people doing it" ... lending through KIVA is us getting out of the way, helping local people empower themselves and their communities.

name: Tree Lovers
loan_because:
Planting and sustaining trees can provide a long lasting source of income, an important food supply, protection for the environment as well as shelter for wildlife and livestock. All this and they add beauty too.
******************************
He who plants a tree, plants a hope.
~Lucy Larcom.
description:
We love trees in all their various shapes and sizes; preferring loans that plant trees or keep them standing and producing, rather than ones that cut them down for their wood. The key word is sustainability. 
We understand that a tree can have a multitude of wonderful uses and here are just a few:
- Alleviates the "Greenhouse Effect" by absorbing CO2, storing the carbon and producing oxygen.
- Prevents or reduces soil erosion and water pollution;  acting as windbreaks, conserving rainwater, and reducing water runoff and sediment deposit after storms.
- Provides shade for livestock and people
- Provides a sustainable source of food or income.
Includes -
- Fruit trees such as apple, apricot, avocado, cacao, calamondin (calamansi),  Carambola(Star Fruit )carob, cherry, custard apple (sugar apple), coconut, durian, fig, guava, grapefruit, jocote (spondias purpurea), jackfruit, Jujube,lemon, lime, longan, mandarins, mango, mangosteen, marang, mulberry, Nanches, nectarine, olive, orange, papaya, peach, persimmon, pitaya (dragonfruit), plum, pomegranate, quince, Sapodilla (Manilkara zapota or Sapota) tamarillo (tree tomato)
- Nut trees such as almond,betel, brazil, cashew, chestnut, hazelnut, Mahogany, Pecan, pistachio, Walnut
- Acacia
- Almacigo 
- Banana, not technically a tree, but we're not going to be pedantic about that!
- Coffee
- Copperwood
- Cork
- Croton tree ( for it's nuts) 
-Eucalyptous
- Falcata
- Grevillea
- Khat - for its leaves.
- Laurel
- Mahogany
- Moringa
- Pacay also known as Ice Cream bean tree 
- Paulownia
- Resin
- Rubber
- Tagua Palm (also known as Ivory Palms or Ivory-nut Palms )- nut is carved and known as vegetable ivory
- Tara
-Thanakha 
Lets not forget that Trees are just beautiful too !

name: Nymans Ur 1851
loan_because: Time is everything. As a business owner, start-up development or a business in much need to move forward, time is precious. \nA lot of business ideas have been successful due to excellent timing, but the most important right now, right here, is the time we put together to help each other. Therefore, as the largest timepiece and watch company in Sweden, Nymans Ur 1851 have chosen to start a team at Kiva so we together can support\npeople and businesses in different parts of the world, to achieve what they strongly believe in and fight for in their time of struggle.
description: Nymans Ur 1851  was established in 1851 in the city of Västerås in Sweden. Today the watch company has five boutiques, two in Västerås, two in Stockholm where the flagship store is located at the prestigious address Biblioteksgatan 1 in the heart of Stockholm and Tidemann in Oslo,  Norway. Within the company there are several departments such as a service shop and after sales department, a business-to-business department and a large online shop, www.Klockor.nu. Since 1851, Nymans Ur has strived to become the most exclusive watch company in Scandinavia. Today Nymans Ur 1851 is the greatest retailer of luxury watch brands in Sweden. The personnel has expert knowledge and the in-house service department has more than eleven certified watchmakers. The service center is the largest and most modern workshop in Scandinavia, with the latest equipment and watchmakers trained by the brands we represent. Today the company consist of over 50 employees with a strong passion for watches, but also for great teamwork and we want to share that teamwork that made Nymans Ur the company it is today, into what Kiva stands for and working together for this important cause.

name: Sunisthefuture
loan_because: We want to spread more sunshine throughout the planet earth by increasing opportunities that would make this planet earth a better place to live. This is accomplished via micro-finance. With as little as $25, any one is able to participate in helping another entrepreneur on planet Earth.
description:
We are hopeful and optimistic that sun, water, wind, and geothermal energy will lead us into a world free from pollution and war.  Let us earthlings look for ways to make this a reality! Sunisthefuture Team supports entrepreneurs from USA and various developing nations in starting/maintaining businesses in solar energy/renewable energy/recycling/energy efficiency. 

Click on "Loans" and "Members" above to see which small businesses we've supported and who are members on Sunisthefuture Team at Kiva.

To see what Green Loans are currently needing help to be funded, click on "Lend" on top of the page, then select (placing a check mark inside the box next to...) for "Green" under ATTRIBUTES in the left hand margin.  At the end of the transaction, be sure to click on "complete order" in order to complete the transaction. Then check to see if the number of loans has been correctly added for your individual profile and for the team you've attributed the loan to. 

For better understanding of :
1. how Kiva works: http://www.kiva.org/about/how

2. how micro-finance works: http://www.kiva.org/about/microfinance 

3. List of Kiva Field Partners: http://www.kiva.org/partners

4. How to become a Field Partner at Kiva: http://www.kiva.org/partners/info 

5. Risk and Due Diligence: http://www.kiva.org/about/risk

To thank you all for your participation at Sunisthefuture Team at Kiva, I've prepared lots of posts and videos on solar energy for your perusal at http://www.sunisthefuture.net and sunisthefuture Youtube Channel at http://www.youtube.com/user/sunisthefuture

Encourage your friends, family, twitter or Facebook audience to join us.

If you should have any questions/concerns/suggestions, please feel free to contact me via message system within Kiva or email me directly at sunisthefuture@gmail.com  

~have a bright and sunny day~
sunisthefuture

loan_because: Pearson’s purpose is to help people make progress in their lives through learning. Social impact lies at the heart of who we are as a business. That is why we have teamed up with Kiva to give all of our 35,000 employees the opportunity to impact a person’s life in a direct and meaningful way and to improve the well being of families and whole communities.
description:
We are the world's leading learning company, with 35,000 employees in more than 70 countries helping people of all ages to make measurable progress in their lives. 

We provide a range of education products and services to institutions, governments and direct to individual learners, that help people everywhere aim higher and fulfill their true potential. 

Our commitment to them requires a holistic approach to education. It begins by using research to understand what sort of learning works best, it continues by bringing together people and organisations to develop ideas, and it comes back round by measuring the outcomes of our products.

Learn more at www.pearson.com

name: The Mindful Bunch
loan_because: We are all ONE and the SAME. We Listen to our HEARTS. We Love Life. We are Mindful.
description:
Please visit our website www.themindfulbunch.org

We are a bunch of mindful people (trying our best to be at least) and we want to change the world for the better in any way we can. Join us and enjoy the ride. 

Mindfulness is not a religion or a system of political beliefs. It is a way of improving your life and seeing more beauty in it by becoming aware of what really is going on around you instead of listening to your ever-going mind that usually doesn't have an "off" button. The central thinking has much in common with many other philosophies. The focus is on trying to improve your own life by being present in everything that you do, to leave the past behind, and to be content to leave the future, as it must be, unknown.  The only thing we now have is the present, which we think of as a gift.  

Making a Kiva loan, in sympathy with the other members of The Mindful Bunch, and the community of Kiva lenders around the globe, is a lovely exercise of Mindfulness.

name: Okta
loan_because:
Every nonprofit starts with a vision of making the world a better place, but they don’t always have the resources or expertise to leverage the best technology. Okta knows that in your organization, every dollar matters. The more of those dollars you can get directly to your cause, the better.

Okta also helps many nonprofits connect more directly with their constituents. Whether it's enabling patients to have easier access to information, or helping volunteers collaborate more easily and more often, Okta's service can bring nonprofits closer to their goals.

Okta is proud to partner with nonprofits by investing in their missions, with 25 free licenses for Okta IT products and preferential pricing for additional licenses and products, making the leading identity service even more accessible.

Okta for Good comprises a number of efforts including donations, community programs and product discounts.
description: Okta Employees and Friends

name: Friends of Bob Harris
loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I wrote a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, 2013).

I hope the book will help you feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, a greater sense of connection to the rest of the world.

name: Our Dumb Friends
whereabouts: BFE, just outside of Rome, NY
loan_because: "Won't somebody please think of the children ?" - Helen Lovejoy -------  \nYes, she might be yellow and a bit two dimensional, but until we make the world the kind of place where children, and yes, dumb animals, can be free of worry, concern and thought, we have not made the world a better place. Come, let us remake the world so no child need ever be confronted by questions, doubt or decisions. name: Shirdi Sai Baba
description: He had no love for perishable things and his sole concern was self-realization. He taught a moral code of love, forgiveness, helping others, charity, contentment, inner peace, and devotion to God and guru. Sai Baba's teaching combined elements of Hinduism and Islam: he gave the Hindu name Dwarakamayi to the mosque he lived in, practiced Hindu and Muslim rituals, taught using words and figures that drew from both traditions, and was buried in Shirdi. One of his well known epigrams, "Sabka Malik Ek " ("One God governs all"), is associated with Islam and Sufism. He always uttered "Allah Malik"("God is King").

name: Learning Fund
loan_because:
When I was a child my parents believed that investing in my education would make my life systematically better. Despite earning a low income for the day, my parents gave up financial security and even sold the family house so that my three siblings and I could have the best education. The pay off period for the investment was long and uncertain, 13 years of school, but my parents faithfully gave even though they could not and maybe would not ever see the fruit. Luckily, years later my siblings and I can see the benefit of my parents faithful investment into our education. 

This fund is for every person who wants to learn but whose circumstances prevent that from being possible. 

This fund will create new possibilities for anyone hungry to learn.

name: Late Loaning Lenders
loan_because:
We hate to see loans being left unfunded on 
Kiva. Although most of these loans are 
pre-funded by the Field Partners, the Field
Partners lose out on the capital if a loan
doesn't get funded on Kiva. We believe that 
this will damage the Field Partners in the long 
term and impair their capacity to make loans to new borrowers (and probably raise the interest rates or fees they have to pay to get a loan)..

We can't save every red-boxed loan, but we try to
make a difference as in the Starfish Story:
http://www.goodreads.com/author/quotes/56782.Loren_Eiseley
Help us fund loans we're already supporting:
http://www.kiva.org/team/late_loaning_lenders/loans?status=fundRaising

Check out Charlotte's Web: http://starfish.dynalias.org
This watchlist for loans suggested by the team members (starfish + offlist) shows:
* the current position in the popularity ranking (considering pages 1 to 5)
* the timestamp of the most recent loan
* the basket amount
Click magnifier icon for more info.  Or read Charlotte’s post at @Charlotte re: #346848
Also known as "CW," or "Charlotte's Web of Wonders"

We invite you to join us and make a difference, too. Please check the team board at 2 am Kiva time, 7 am Kiva time, 1 pm Kiva time and 6 pm Kiva time to coordinate lending.
Kiva time means PST - Pacific Standard Time, the time zone of San Francisco, where Kiva HQ is. They follow daylight saving time in the summer.

See our team fund page:
http://www.kiva.org/lender/kivalllfund
description:
Alan's account of the founding of LLL is on the  team board @Alan re: #260143. Loans that are nearing expiry won't get funded if they don't get noticed. We look for loans that are about to expire by using the Sort By:
"Expiring Soon" option instead of the default "Popularity", and then work to get them funded.

A Team LLL glossary (contributed by team member Tony):

“You’ve Got Email,” as explained by team member Tim:   It's a twice a month email that goes out to the Kiva lenders who have funds sitting unused in their accounts. Mainly the smaller lenders who don't look obsessively at Kiva and are likely not to be aware that they are in credit. Usually linked to the Expiring Loans list and therefore it creates a sort of house cleaning effect there. Today (April 10, 2016) was unusual in that it came out on a Sunday, so the effect has been more muted and will last longer. When it happens Monday - Friday, the impact is amazing with loaning suddenly peaking at 60-90 loans a minute.

Red Loans: Loans that have less than five days to be funded, identifiable by the red box with the notice that says "Only x days left!" or 
"Only x hours and y minutes left!"

LLL - Late Loaning Lenders: this team, where 
lenders work together to keep loans from 
expiring.

SFDD - Starfish Daily Dozen: Under current 
practice, one of these lists is prepared and 
posted for each day, to help LLL lenders focus 
and coordinate their lending on a targeted 
group of loans (the Starfish or SF). The lists 
are prepared by a group of volunteers who 
seek to be objective in selecting the loans to 
be included in their lists. They also seek to 
spread out the loans in each list over a 24 hour 
period and to share the joy among the Field 
Partners with loans expiring during that period, 
but their efforts are always constrained by the 
choice of loans that are available for inclusion 
in the list. Loans with larger amounts needed 
will be included in the period immediately after 
each Credit Day, when lenders are feeling 
flush, but the lists will become less ambitious 
when the LLL lenders are feeling poor.

GG - Gorgeous Group: The SFDD list-makers usually add one or two of these loans at the end of the SF daily dozen lists. As the name 
implies, only group loans are picked. When it is 
first posted, a typical GG loan will expire two 
days or more after the list is posted. It will 
usually be retained as a GG until it becomes 
Fully Funded or moves into Starfish range. The amount needed when the loan is selected as a GG will vary depending on the time of month.

OPM - Abbreviation for "other people's money."  Our main lending method is to coordinate LLL team members' loans, so that we make several loans to a borrower within a short period of time. This will move the borrower's loan request up in Kiva's "popularity" sort and get the loan noticed by other people (non-members of the LLL team).  Many loans then get their funding completed by loans from those non-LLL members.  By attracting other lenders' attention to our Starfish loans in this way, we multiply the impact of our finite funds, and save more loans from expiring than we otherwise could.

RTR - Reduce the Red: These lists are posted by the SFDD list-makers when there are not enough loans set to expire in a Starfish window to populate an SFDD list.  The RTR lists contains loans with planned expirations later in the Kiva cycle.  "Red" is a reference to the red 
boxes that are added to a loan description 
when the loan is about to expire without full 
funding.

Bulge: A short period in which a great many loans have their scheduled funding expiration times. This may happen when, for example, the volunteer coordinators at Kiva offer a promo of some kind to the editors & translators, to get them to do a lot of work in a very short period of time. Bulge loans are prime candidates for inclusion in Reduce the Red lists.

BTB - Battling the Boxes: On those days where 
there aren't 12 loans that qualify as "Starfish," the listmakers will include loans that have their red boxes, but more than 24 hours left before their deadline, to make up the 12 loans for the list. The criteria are similar to SF 
loans, i.e., one per field partner and reasonable 
amounts left to fund (not too much; not too 
little), except that these loans may have a longer time left before their expiry date. If they gain good traction on their first BTB day, they may be carried forward. If not ... they stand a second chance as SF.

FF - Fully Funded: This is LLL code for a loan 
that has received all the loans required for it to be removed from the list of loans that are raising funds and to move into paying back status.

Lars Ratio: the average funding per hour that is needed for a loan to become fully funded.  As a rule of thumb, in a loan's last 24 hours on Kiva, it's more likely to end up fully funded if its Lars ratio is no greater than 100.  (I.e., if it needs to raise no more than $100 per hour.)
(Developed by team member Lars)

Wiedergänger (contributed by Maria) - German expression, literal translation "again walker," meaning "undead," i.e. a person that has died but comes back, aka a zombie. Here it means a loan that disappears from the page, but comes back again because somebody didn't check out their basket.

Ruma sana (contributed by Jouko and Potkukelkka) - Finnish expression, literal translation "ugly words."  It is a phrase to use when you are very frustrated, but want to stop just short of actual cursing -- for example, when the Kiva site repeatedly logs you out when you are trying to rescue an expiring loan at the last second.

Windmills (as in "tilting at windmills"): From the book The Ingenious Gentleman Don Quixote of La Mancha.  It refers to a knight on a horse running at a windmill with his lance, attempting to "defeat" the windmill (the failure of which act is a foregone conclusion). When an expiring loan is referred to as a windmill, people are saying that they think the loan may be a lost cause already ... but since we're all gluttons for punishment, and since you never know what will happen on Kiva, sometimes we take a run at the loan anyway!  

See data about all loans currently fundraising on Kiva:
http://kivatools.com
See data about loans that have been mentioned on the LLL board, including the most recent lending activity on each loan:
http://starfish.dynalias.org/
See loans in real time, as they are made: http://kivalive.com/index2.php
See "the fireworks" when lending is very fast:
http://www.kiva.org/live

Lists are posted on the LLL Team message 
board. Join us!

name: Beyond Aid
loan_because:
Can increasing bilateral and multilateral aid really make poverty history? Let's challenge the school of thought... If you have an opinion, for or against, join us! We focus on inspiring African entrepreneurial development as an alternative to the western aid model.

Africa Beyond Aid is NOT a charity, we are an overland expedition team of passionate individuals producing a self-funded TV and Web documentary on the emergence of an inspiring generation of Africans working towards economic freedom. 

We ask whether the aid model devised by the West has dumped Africa into a vicious cycle of perpetual infancy and aid dependence resulting in civil unrest, human rights abuse, corruption and economic demise? 

Note: we are talking bilateral and multilateral aid here (development aid), not emergency and humanitarian aid!

This documentary investigates and reports on inspiring African entrepreneurial development as an alternative to the western aid model. It discovers the benefits and drawbacks of an alternative blueprint for sustained growth based on the needs of the people, cutting off the Wabenzi’s (men of Mercedes Benz in Swahili) 70-year access to a bottomless pot of tainted aid-gold. 

The production saw us driving overland from Geneva, Switzerland to Cape Town, South Africa to covering case studies at grass roots level in some of the most remote regions of Africa. 

We followed and discovered local communities and their entrepreneurial stars who, with the use of innovative entrepreneurial mechanisms, finance development to assuage poverty. We lived with these communities and experience the rebirth of their continent. 

Get involved! Share your thoughts, here or on our website www.africabeyondaid.org
description:
Beyond Aid is an overland expedition team producing an inspiring TV and Web documentary on sustainable development in Africa. We are creating awareness for direct investment as an alternative model for African Economic Development.

In one sentence: We investigate an alternative, inspirational blueprint for African development as the 'aid model' was proven to be grossly ineffective in Africa over the past 60 years. 

We certainly do not think we have the answer to everything and cannot cover every single variable in this documentary, but we do say: Look, these people are making a success despite their lack of resources and without aid, so maybe we should look at ways to support them directly, rather than categorising Africans as aid-dependents or god forbid - trust their/our corrupt governments to help out.

name: Médecins Sans Frontières / Doctors Without Borders
description:
This Kiva team makes loans in honor of Doctors Without Borders / Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF). Médecins Sans Frontières is an international medical humanitarian organization created by doctors and journalists in France in 1971.

According to their website, MSF provides aid in nearly 60 countries to people whose survival is threatened by violence, neglect, or catastrophe, primarily due to armed conflict, epidemics, malnutrition, exclusion from health care, or natural disasters.

MSF operates independently of any political, military, or religious agenda.  In 1999, MSF won the Nobel Peace Prize.

The Kiva team is not officially linked to MSF. All loans made in the name of this team, remain the property of the lender, and are not considered a donation.

name: Wimmera District, Victoria, Australia
loan_because: "Microfinance stands as one of the most promising and cost-effective tools in the fight against global poverty."\nJonathan Morduch, Chair, UN Expert Group on Poverty Statistics
description:
This team is an open team and therefore anyone is invited to contribute and be part of the team, whether they are associated with the wimmera or not.

"Where once the poor were commonly seen as passive victims, microfinance recognizes that poor people are remarkable reservoirs of energy and knowledge. And while the lack of financial services is a sign of poverty, today it is also understood as an untapped opportunity to create markets, bring people in from the margins and give them the tools with which to help themselves."
Kofi Annan

name: World Domination Summit
loan_because: We want to make a difference. We believe in BEING the change we wish to see. We want to track the progress, impact, and see the butterfly effect that this magical weekend had on us!
description: In July 2012, a small army of remarkable people converged on Portland, Oregon for a weekend of strategizing and adventure. “Living a remarkable life in a conventional world” was one theme, and the audience was packed with diversity. Chris Guillebeau & an anonymous donor made a $100 investment in each of the attendees, and left US with a simple charge: put it to good use! Start a project, surprise someone, or do something entirely different. Some team members may use their $100 this way, others may just divert their normal Kiva lending to this team. I just wanted to TAKE immediate action and DO SOMETHING within 24 hours of returning home. This is it!

name: In Loving Memory of Baby Henry John Helms-North
loan_because: Our beautiful son Baby Henry John Helms-North died shortly before he was born at 11am on the 18th July 2009.
description: This fund was set up and is managed by Henry's parents, Rob and Katharine Helms-North. The fund was established with the help of Henry's family as well as friends of the family, colleagues, church members and other Kiva supporters. Like many, we have been wanting to do something to help those in need  become self-sufficient but never felt we had the resources to take action. Baby Henry's death has taught us that if you mean to do something today, you should not put it off until tomorrow. Kiva and micro-finance provides us with an opportunity to do, on Baby Henry's behalf, something that is positive and can be looked after and nurtured by us. Thanks to the support of our lending team over 1250 people have been helped in the developing world with loans. Please feel free to join in and make a difference.

name: Jesse and Liz's Wedding Favor
loan_because:
In appreciation for their wedding guests, Jesse and Liz have chosen to make a micro-loan donation to Kiva.org, an organization that facilitates micro-lending to people in need around the world.

To acknowledge the generosity Jesse and Liz have been shown by friends and family, they have invited their wedding guests to share in the spirit of gratitude by joining them to support people around the world who are starting new ventures, just as Jesse and Liz are starting their married lives together.  

As these Kiva loans are repaid, Jesse and Liz will continue to loan to new people projects.

name: NED Universtiy of Engineering and Technology, Pakistan
loan_because: we are blessed
description:
The NED University of Engineering and technology is the oldest institution now in Pakistan for teaching and turning out Graduate Engineers; it is in the Public Sector – i.e. Government owned – having begun initially as an Engineering College in 1922 established by subscriptions from private donors. The University retains the initials in honour of the principal donor for that College – Nadirshaw Edulji Dinshaw in its name! Like other such Government owned institutions in developing countries, it has had over the years to overcome various handicaps ranging from shortage of funds to “brain drain” of Faculty Members as well as students. Nevertheless, because of its transparent admission policy which has established its reputation over the years, it attracts the best students – including even some foreigners lacking resources for seeking admission in Universities of developed countries!

This University presently offers undergraduate programmes in Twenty Five (25) Engineering disciplines along with one each in Architecture and in Computer Science and Information Technology. It is also presently offering Thirty-Four (34) Master’s level postgraduate programmes; this number is also increasing each year. At present, the programmes for Doctoral studies are restricted to Faculty Members; this university is implementing its wide-ranging Development Programme in which its demands for Faculty Development are of such intensity that they leave no room for offering Doctorate programmes for external candidates.

The independent Internet Facility installed in June 1999 was the first of its kind – making this University an independent Internet Service Provider for internal usage. This facility has since been augmented by the PERN facility provided by the Higher Education Commission and supplemented by the portal facility for usage by all its Departments. This University has also been one of – if not the very first – in establishing liaison with industries, public utilities and companies engaged in Consultancy and Construction activities. These efforts have greatly facilitated and also extended its scope for students obtaining gainful employment almost immediately after graduation. This University can thus – without pretending to possess the ability to provide its students the same facilities as in developed countries – certainly offer them intellectual challengers in competing with students possessing abilities of level equal to if not sometimes higher than those in developed countries.

name: Cans for Kiva
loan_because: We care about the planet and the people on it.
description: Hi, I'm Evan. I live in California, United States. I collect aluminum soda cans, crush them, and turn them in for CRV (california refund value, money). I then take the money and loan it here! I use cans to make sure they will be recycled. I crush the cans so that I can use less plastic bags when transporting the cans to my local recycling center. Please join and help my team so that we can make a difference to all people of the world and the planet we live on.

1. NWTF can be TRUSTED (see their financial reports pp. 20-21 at their 2010 ANNUAL REPORT. http://nwtf.ph/reports/annual/AR2010.pdf

description: VISIT & EXPLORE : www.nwtf.ph\n  NWTF has struck me as an organization that has the well-being of its member clients at the heart of all its activities. It is a pioneer in social performance management, and uses the progress out of poverty index (developed by Grameen) to measure a clients' poverty level following each loan cycle." Joanne, Kiva Fellow (volunteer)
